description: The deadliest terror attack in more than a decade in Moscow shattered the illusion of security that Vladimir Putin has carefully cultivated in the more than two years since he invaded Ukraine.
title: Deadly Terror Attack Shakes Russia After Putin’s Vote Triumph

description: Venezuela’s US-backed opposition agreed to replace banned presidential candidate María Corina Machado ahead of the July election, amid doubt that it will be able to register a challenger to run against President Nicolás Maduro.
title: Venezuela Opposition Agrees on Machado Replacement for July Vote

description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken made a last-minute decision Friday to meet in Tel Aviv with protesters pushing Israel to strike a deal that would bring home the hostages still being held by Hamas militants in the Gaza Strip.
title: Blinken Persists in ‘Groundhog Day’ Travels Seeking Gaza Results

description: The Securities and Exchange Commission told the US Supreme Court it should to turn away an Elon Musk appeal and leave intact his agreement to have an in-house lawyer pre-approve his social media posts about Tesla Inc.
title: SEC Urges Supreme Court to Reject Musk’s ‘Twitter Sitter’ Appeal

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump, Republicans Facing a Cash Crunch Heading Into Election

description: Colombia’s institutions can withstand President Gustavo Petro’s attempt to rewrite the Constitution and bypass other branches of power in his bid to change the country’s economic model, according to the head of Congress.
title: Petro’s Whims Can Be Kept in Check, Colombia Congress Chief Says

description: Four-term Republican Congressman Mike Gallagher said he will quit Congress, leaving House Speaker Mike Johnson able to lose only one lawmaker on any party-line vote starting April 19.
title: Slim Republican House Majority Shrinks Further as Lawmaker Quits

description: A top Russian grain trader said that its wheat exports have been disrupted after the country’s agricultural watchdog faulted its cargoes for not meeting safety and quality standards.
title: Top Russia Grain Trader Says Exports Blocked by Agricultural Watchdog

description: Canada’s planned reduction in temporary residents is set to add downward pressure to inflation and economic growth in the coming months, and the policy will likely halve its population growth rate when it takes full effect next year, economists say.
title: Canada’s Economy to Slow With New Limits on Temporary Migrants

description: Javier Milei is a “poor little ham” sandwiched between two powerful figures seeking to shape the direction of the Argentine leader’s government, Vice President Victoria Villarruel said in the clearest sign yet of friction within the administration.
title: Milei’s VP Vies With His Sister for Influence in Argentina

description: The US must explain why its troops and drone operations in Niger are legal and how they benefit the West African nation, a government official said.
title: US Must Justify Troops and Drone Base in Niger, Government Says

description: The European Union is ready to get serious about fending off Russia – now it just needs to figure out how to pay for it all.
title: EU Starts Out on a Long, Costly Path to Putin-Proof Its Defense

description: House Republicans asked Hawaiian Electric Co. to answer additional questions and provide more documents as part of their probe into the utility’s role in last year’s deadly Lahaina wildfire.
title: Hawaiian Electric Drops as GOP Seeks More Details in Fire Probe

description: Russian spies waged a hacking campaign targeting German political parties by attempting to trick them with fake dinner invitations, according to new research from Mandiant.
title: Russian Hackers Tried Duping German Politicians Before Elections

description: South Korean Do Kwon presided over one of the biggest busts ever in the volatile crypto sector. His Terraform Labs Pte created the TerraUSD stablecoin, which was meant to have a constant $1 value via a complex mix of algorithms and trader incentives involving a sister token, Luna. Their combined value soared past $60 billion until confidence in the system evaporated in May 2022, prompting investors to flee and denuding the tokens of value. With Kwon’s whereabouts unclear, South Korea issued an a
title: How Do Kwon Went From Crypto King to Fugitive to Jail

description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said he told Israeli leaders Friday about alternatives to its plan for a major ground operation in Rafah, and that US officials will provide details when an Israeli delegation visits Washington next week.
title: Blinken Says US Will Offer Israel Alternatives to Rafah Invasion

description: Republican Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene took the first steps Friday to remove Mike Johnson as House speaker, threatening another potential GOP shake-up and more infighting ahead of the November elections.
title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Threatens to Remove Johnson as House Speaker

description: The House passed a $1.2 trillion government funding bill hours before a midnight Friday partial government shutdown deadline, rebuffing Republican hardliners’ demands for deep cuts to domestic spending.
title: House Passes $1.2 Trillion Bill, Hours Before Shutdown Deadline

description: Donald Trump said he has almost $500 million in cash on hand, a hefty sum that would still fall short of covering the former president’s appeal bond due in three days in New York state’s civil fraud suit.
title: Trump Says He Has ‘Almost $500 Million’ Cash Ahead of Bond Deadline

description: Canadian government spending is growing faster than revenue, and interest payments are continuing to climb, as Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland prepares to deliver her budget next month.
title: Canada Government Spending Grows at Twice the Pace of Revenue

description: Senegal’s ex-President Abdoulaye Wade’s Senegalese Democratic Party in a potential game changer ahead of March 24 presidential elections, threw its support behind opposition candidate Bassirou Diomaye Faye.
title: Senegal Ex-President Wade’s Party Backs Faye in March Vote

description: One of Latin America’s most unpopular leaders is now facing scrutiny over an array of luxury watches she has worn during public appearances, and how she can afford them given her modest salary.
title: Embattled Peru Leader Faces Scrutiny Over How She Can Afford a Rolex

description: The UK government will back plans to scrap the newest part of London’s strategy to reduce vehicular pollution just weeks from the capital’s mayoral elections.
title: UK Government Backs Plan to Scrap Sadiq Khan’s ULEZ Expansion

description: Tens of thousands are living in hotels unwilling to return
title: Fear of a Hezbollah Raid Creates Ghost Towns in Israel’s North

description: President Joe Biden is appointing two new economic advisers, as he advances his administration’s industrial policy and tightens restrictions on China ahead of an election in which both issues will figure prominently.
title: Biden Taps New Advisers Focused on China, Inflation in 2024

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: It's All Kicking Off: Bank of England Ponders Cuts As Politicians Talk Football

description: Senior Ukrainian officials defended Kyiv’s attacks on oil infrastructure deep within Russian territory following a report that US officials had warned against the operation because of surging oil prices and the prospect of Kremlin retaliation.
title: Ukraine Defends Russian Oil Strikes After Report of US Warning

description: China relaxed rules governing cross-border data flows by narrowing the kinds of data that require security evaluation, addressing a key concern of foreign businesses who have said the previous regulation disrupted their operations.
title: China Loosens Cross-Border Data Rules to Ease Business Pressure

description: Russia and China vetoed the strongest move yet by the US to pressure Israel at the United Nations Security Council, saying that a resolution endorsing a cease-fire in Gaza was still too weak.
title: Russia, China Veto US Resolution at UN for a Gaza Cease-Fire

description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said the government will meet its objective of reining in the budget deficit without raising taxes, even as weak economic growth and disappointing tax revenues undermine its initial plans.
title: Le Maire Says France to Meet Deficit Goal Without Tax Increases

description: The Dutch government is lobbying Unilever Plc to list its €17 billion ($18.4 billion) ice-cream unit in the Netherlands, having been encouraged by comments made by the consumer goods giant’s CEO earlier this week.
title: Dutch Ramp Up Pressure on Unilever for €17 Billion Ice Cream Listing

description: Germany’s upper house of parliament passed a watered-down bill to provide €3.2 billion ($3.5 billion) of tax-relief measures for companies, ending months of wrangling between the coalition government, federal states and opposition parties.
title: Germany Passes €3.2 Billion Bill to Ease Burden on Companies

description: A law partially legalizing cannabis for recreational use in Germany will take effect on April 1 as planned, removing uncertainty for investors and startups in the sector after some lawmakers had threatened to block it.
title: German Upper House Passes Law Partially Legalizing Cannabis Use

description: Thailand’s parliament approved a nearly $96 billion spending plan for the 2024 fiscal year, belatedly clearing the way for Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s administration to ramp up public spending to support Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy.
title: Thailand Lawmakers Approve $96 Billion Budget Bill After Delay

description: President Vladimir Putin’s spokesman said Russia is “in a state of war” in Ukraine, casting aside the Kremlin’s usual description of the invasion as a so-called special military operation.
title: Putin’s Spokesman Says Russia Is ‘In a State of War’ in Ukraine

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Cash Is Becoming Trump’s Achilles Heel in Presidential Race

description: While the rising number of immigrants in the US has sowed division among politicians across the country — and stoked angst among a swath of voters — there’s one place where almost everyone seems on the same, upbeat, page: Wall Street.
title: Immigration Is Fueling US Economic Growth While Politicians Rage

description: Ireland’s Paschal Donohoe gave his support to Simon Harris, who is the front runner to become the country’s next prime minister after Leo Varadkar announced his resignation earlier this week.
title: Ireland’s Donohoe Backs Simon Harris to Be Next Prime Minister

description: Malaysia abandoned its plan to do away with automatic citizenship for foundlings and abandoned children, following weeks of public criticism against the government.
title: Malaysia Drops Controversial Citizenship Plan After Backlash

description: Malaysia followed Australia in declining an opportunity to host the 2026 Commonwealth Games due to cost concerns, as the organizers’ search for a new host continues with just two years left before the games start.
title: Malaysia Declines Offer to Host Commonwealth Games, Cites Costs

description: House Republicans are falling further behind on campaign cash with little-known House Speaker Mike Johnson at the helm.
title: House Speaker’s Unpopularity With Rich Donors Widens Republicans’ Fundraising Gap

description: Some European leaders are warming up to the idea to use financial engineering to boost the profits from the immobilized Russian sovereign assets to generate a much higher level of funding for Ukraine.
title: Europe Considers Leveraging Frozen Russian Assets for Ukraine

description: Presidential election taking place as fast-growing economy prepares for oil and gas bonanza
title: Senegal to Pick New Leader as it Gears Up for Energy Boom

description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — A former Filipino congressman accused of masterminding the brazen killings of a provincial governor and several others has been arrested in East Timor and will be deported to the Philippines, Manila officials said Friday.
title: Ex-Filipino Congressman Accused of Masterminding Governor's Murder Is Arrested in East Timor

description: South Africa’s speaker of parliament is taking “special leave” after her house was raided this week as part of a corruption investigation.
title: South Africa’s Speaker of Parliament Steps Aside Amid Probe

description: Russian missile and drone attacks damaged electricity generation and transmission systems in several Ukrainian regions, causing power cuts in some areas, according to the Energy Ministry in Kyiv.
title: Ukraine Says Russian Missiles Struck Power Network Across Nation

description: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni named his son, who says he wants to succeed his father as the nation’s leader, as chief of the defense forces.
title: Ugandan President Museveni Appoints His Son as Army Chief

description: South Korea is tapping into a multinational framework to review export controls for sensitive products like semiconductor-related equipment, the country’s trade minister said, an approach that may complicate US efforts to curtail China’s influence on technology supply chains.
title: South Korea Targets Multi-Country Talks for Chip Export Controls

description: Parliamentary speaker Peter Pellegrini has vowed to back the government if he’s picked for the presidency.
title: Russia-Friendly Leader May Get Huge Power Boost in Slovak Vote

description: The royal flush of top leadership proves diversity is alive and kicking. Stay encouraged.
title: Britain Is a Big Tent, Not a Narrow Tabernacle

description: Poland’s ruling party is gearing up for a drawn-out probe of central bank Governor Adam Glapinski, a lawmaker involved in the case said, warning of potential attempts to scupper the proceedings.
title: Polish Lawmaker Expects Lengthy Probe of Central Bank Governor

description: The European Union risks falling behind on key efforts to regulate cryptocurrencies because its securities watchdog lacks the resources to evaluate their potential impact on financial markets quickly enough.
title: Shorthanded EU Regulator Risks Falling Behind on Crypto Rules

description: The Philippines said China made dangerous moves and deployed a chopper during Manila’s research mission to South China Sea, the latest flare-up in lingering tensions between the two nations over disputed waters.
title: Philippines Says China Made Dangerous Sea Moves, Used Chopper

description: China’s bid to woo top global executives at an annual forum in Beijing this weekend is already being clouded by speculation over which top leaders they’ll meet.
title: China’s Big CEO Summit Clouded by Doubts Over Policy, Access

description: Australia’s Ambassador to the US Kevin Rudd would wear criticism of him by former President Donald Trump as a “badge of honor,” ex-Australian diplomat Geoff Raby told Bloomberg Television on Friday.
title: Trump Criticism Is a ‘Badge of Honor’ for Rudd, Ex-Diplomat Says

description: The Home Secretary has vowed to crack down on spiking as he said perpetrators will be "held to account" by changes in the law.
title: Home Secretary Vows to Hold Perpetrators to Account by Updating Law on Spiking
